results.headline: Review: In ‘Unlocking the Cage,’ a Struggle to Raise the Legal Status of Chimpanzees
results.summary_short: This documentary centers on a lawyer’s quest to show that intelligent species like chimps and whales merit some legal protections accorded to humans.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Unlocking the Cage

results.headline: Review: Anthony D. Weiner’s Self-Destruction Is a Documentary’s Focus
results.summary_short: This portrait examines the troubled career of a New York politician and the sexting scandals that brought him down.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Weiner

results.headline: Review: In ‘Maggie’s Plan,’ Greta Gerwig Aspires to Motherhood on Her Terms
results.summary_short: This film, the fifth from Rebecca Miller, stars Ms. Gerwig as a millennial who, on the way to finding a sperm donor, falls for a part-time professor.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Maggie's Plan

results.headline: Review: ‘The Other Side,’ a Harrowing Visit With People on the Margins
results.summary_short: The documentarian Roberto Minervini portrays drug use, alienation and militarization among the disaffected in West Monroe, La.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Other Side

results.headline: Review: ‘O.J.: Made in America,’ an Unflinching Take on His Rise and Fall
results.summary_short: This ESPN documentary extends the narrative beyond the O.J. Simpson murder trial, as a biography and a history of race, fame, sports and Los Angeles.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of O.J.: Made in America

results.headline: Review: ‘Kaili Blues,’ a Dreamy Trek With Otherworldly Beauty
results.summary_short: Bi Gan’s meandering film, centering on a search for a nephew, is indifferent to plot but has a compelling fantastical quality.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Kaili Blues

results.headline: Review: In ‘Manhattan Night,’ Adrien Brody Navigates an Urban Underbelly
results.summary_short: Starring Adrien Brody as a tabloid columnist, this film deploys conventions evoking “Chinatown” and older classics but ends up feeling prosaic.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Manhattan Night

results.headline: Review: ‘Almost Holy’ Demonstrates a Pastor’s Tough Love for Street Kids in Ukraine
results.summary_short: This documentary by Steve Hoover examines Gennadiy Mokhnenko, a pastor in Ukraine who rehabilitates homeless children at his center, Pilgrim Republic.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Almost Holy

results.headline: Review: ‘The Angry Birds Movie,’ a Superficially Amiable Ball of Fluff
results.summary_short: In this animated adaptation of the smartphone video game, Jason Sudeikis gives voice to an avian hothead suspicious of the newly arrived green pigs.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Angry Birds Movie

results.headline: Review: In ‘Ma Ma,’ Penélope Cruz as a Cancer Patient Finding Love
results.summary_short: Julio Medem’s film steers Ms. Cruz’s character through a melodrama involving an illness, surgery, pregnancy and the thematic notion of rebirth.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Ma Ma

results.headline: Review: ‘A Moment of Silence’ Follows the Evo Morales Era in Bolivia
results.summary_short: This documentary centers on the first Bolivian president to rise from the country’s indigenous majority.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of A Moment of Silence

results.headline: Review: ‘Welcome to Happiness,’ With Kyle Gallner Seeking Answers
results.summary_short: What if we could change our past? The film, written and directed by Oliver Thompson, wonders.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Welcome to Happiness

results.headline: Review: ‘Neighbors 2: Sorority Rising’ Has an Animal House for the Fairer Sex
results.summary_short: Nicholas Stoller’s sequel to the 2014 original stars a returning Seth Rogen and Rose Byrne as a couple taking on new raucous collegians next door.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Neighbors 2: Sorority Rising

results.headline: Review: ‘Pervert Park’ Presents Sex Offenders in Their Own Words
results.summary_short: By showing these men and women, who live in their own trailer park, struggling with their demons, this documentary evokes a mix of revulsion and pity.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Pervert Park

results.headline: Review: ‘Phantom Detective,’ a Dawdling South Korean Noir
results.summary_short: A detective searches for the man who killed his mother 20 years earlier, in Jo Sung-hee’s film.

results.headline: Review: ‘The Nice Guys’ Pairs Gosling and Crowe as Slapstick Detectives
results.summary_short: Shane Black’s convoluted caper blends pop-culture riffs from the ’70s with a zany mix of mistaken identity, nudity and grisly murders.

results.headline: Review: In ‘Last Days in the Desert,’ Ewan McGregor Is a Conflicted Jesus
results.summary_short: Rodrigo García’s depiction of the temptations of Christ is a primal meditation on patriarchal authority.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Last Days in the Desert

results.headline: Review: ‘Sunset Song’ Shows a Woman’s True Grit
results.summary_short: In Terence Davies’s film, scenes of Scottish rural life are stitched together in a slow-moving story rife with both natural beauty and tragedy.

results.headline: Review: In ‘Love & Friendship,’ Austen Meets Whit Stillman
results.summary_short: This adaptation, starring Kate Beckinsale, is enlivened by Mr. Stillman’s keen eye for character and Austen’s sense of fun.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Love & Friendship

results.headline: Review: ‘Cash Only’: Repaying a Crook, When Things Turn Gritty
results.summary_short: In Malik Bader’s drama, the clock is ticking fast for a desperate Detroit landlord who steals money from the wrong person.
